deck: Grand Theft Auto is a sandbox-violence game, that has drawn attention all over the world, and has pretty much become one of the most noticeable criminal-sandbox franchises ever.

games.name: Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories
Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories
Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City

name: Grand Theft Auto

deck: The Fallout franchise is a post-apocalyptic series of role-playing and tactics games originally developed by Black Isle, and most recently, Bethesda Softworks and Obsidian Entertainment.
name: Fallout

deck: Tactical, Espionage, Action. A revered and long-running series directed by Hideo Kojima.

games.name: Metal Gear Solid: Digital Graphic Novel
Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops Plus
Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots

Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes

name: Metal Gear

deck: A part of the Metal Gear series, often also considered its own series all the same.

games.name: Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes
Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops Plus
Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots
The Document of Metal Gear Solid 2

Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes

name: Metal Gear Solid

deck: Originally starting as a World War II-themed first-person shooter, the Call of Duty franchise now incorporates other time periods and conflicts and can be found on virtually every modern platform.

games.name: Call of Duty 2: Big Red One
Call of Duty: Roads to Victory
Call of Duty: World at War
Call of Duty: World at War Final Fronts

Call of Duty: Black Ops Zombies

Call of Duty: Black Ops III

name: Call of Duty

deck: The Modern Warfare franchise includes some of the most popular first person shooters of all time.

games.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Reflex Edition

name: Modern Warfare

deck: Bioshock is a series of award winning first person shooters published by 2K Games. The first and third games were developed by Ken Levine's Irrational Games, while the second installment was handled by 2K Marin.
name: BioShock

deck: The first-person shooter / RPG franchise from Gearbox Software and 2K games.
name: Borderlands

deck: Rocksteady Studios and WB Montreal's superhero series that focuses on a more dark and serious Batman.
name: Batman: Arkham

deck: Debuting in Detective Comics in 1939, Batman has had a large amount of success in almost every other media, but has had a somewhat troubling history in the world of video games.

games.name: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker
Batman: The Brave and the Bold: The Videogame
Batman v Superman: Who Will Win

name: Batman

deck: DC is the franchise that brought us great heroes such as Superman, Batman, and the Flash.

games.name: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker
The Death and Return of Superman
Aquaman: War of the Water Worlds
Watchmen: The End is Nigh Part 2
Batman: The Brave and the Bold: The Videogame
Green Lantern: Rise of the Manhunters
Scribblenauts Unmasked: A DC Comics Adventure
LEGO DC Comics Super Heroes: Team Up
Batman v Superman: Who Will Win

name: DC Universe

deck: The Assassin's Creed franchise follows the never-ending, secret war between the Assassin Brotherhood and the Templar Order, in various historical settings, told from the perspective of the modern day.
name: Assassin's Creed

deck: The Battlefield series is created by Digital Illusions CE and published by Electronic Arts. The games focus on large maps and vehicle combat with a strong focus on class-based teamwork. The Battlefield series spans multiple platforms and has a strong PC based following.
name: Battlefield

deck: A console-oriented spin-off of the Battlefield series, focusing on squad gameplay and destructible environments
name: Battlefield: Bad Company

deck: Mass Effect is a science fiction franchise created by BioWare. The main games follow the adventures of Commander Shepard, the first human Spectre, as he tries to protect the galaxy from an ancient and malevolent alien race.
name: Mass Effect

deck: Capcom's Resident Evil (or Biohazard in Japan) series continues to draw in players with its stories of hideous mutations and the pharmaceutical company Umbrella Inc., and is their number one selling franchise of all time.
name: Resident Evil

deck: Red Dead is a pair of third-person western action titles developed by Rockstar San Diego and published by Rockstar Games.
name: Red Dead

deck: Troubled novelist Alan Wake becomes an unlikely saviour who must battle supernatural evil after he learns there's a very good reason why humans are afraid of the darkness...
name: Alan Wake

deck: Humanity is at war with an underground enemy known as the Locust horde, and the player must use cover and team work to survive.
name: Gears of War

deck: The Dead Space franchise tells the story of the outbreak of the Necromorph infection on the space mining vessel, U.S.G Ishimura.
name: Dead Space

deck: The franchise that defined the Xbox, Halo contains some of the most popular games ever released. The Halo FPS titles are revered for their excellent gamepad control and high-quality online multiplayer. The franchise now contains novels, soda tie-ins, an RTS spin-off, toys, and more.

games.name: Halo 4: King of the Hill Fueled by Mountain Dew

name: Halo

deck: The Left 4 Dead series follows the survivors of a zombie apocalypse, working together to get to safety.
name: Left 4 Dead

deck: Uncharted is a series of action-adventure games, combining third-person shooting with three-dimensional platforming. It follows the journeys of treasure hunter Nathan Drake.
name: Uncharted

deck: A series of platforming games taking place in a dystopian future through a first-person view.
name: Mirror's Edge

deck: A Sucker Punch-developed, Sony-published series of open world action platformers starring Cole MacGrath, a bike messenger given electrical superpowers in an accident.
name: inFamous

deck: Star Wars is a space fantasy film franchise that initially told the tale of Luke Skywalker and a rebellion's struggle against the evil Galactic Empire. It has spawned over one hundred games, six sequels/prequels and at least millions of different shirts, action figures and other merchandise.

deck: The Force Unleashed is a Star Wars sub-franchise focusing on over-the-top use of Force Powers in a hack and slash type environment

games.name: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II

name: Star Wars: The Force Unleashed

deck: Fable is an RPG franchise, best known for morality based games and outspoken lead designer Peter Molyneux
name: Fable

deck: A sci-fi first-person/third-person shooter franchise for Sony platforms, developed by Guerrilla Games.
name: Killzone

deck: Prince of Persia is an action adventure series created by Jordan Mechner in the late eighties.  The original was a beloved 2D platformer, while the series' later incarnation in The Sands of Time set the bar for modern platforming and continues to influence games a decade later.

games.name: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Prince of Persia 2: The Shadow & The Flame
Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones
Prince of Persia: The Fallen King
Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands

name: Prince of Persia

deck: The Portal franchise is a series of games that involve creating portals to teleport the player and objects through various puzzles. It also exists within the same universe as the Half-Life series.
name: Portal

deck: Capcom's Street Fighter franchise became popular with the release of Street Fighter II, and has gone on to become one of the company's most beloved franchises.

games.name: Street Fighter II' Turbo: Hyper Fighting
Marvel Super Heroes Vs. Street Fighter
Super Street Fighter II Turbo HD Remix
Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo HD Remix
Super Street Fighter II: Turbo Revival
Hyper Street Fighter II: The Anniversary Edition
Street Fighter II: The World Warrior
Japan Sumo Cup: Yokozuna Vs Street Fighter

name: Street Fighter

deck: Street Fighter IV, set between Street Fighter II and Street Fighter III, has been released multiple times with added content and gameplay tweaks, much like its predecessors.
name: Street Fighter IV

deck: Final Fantasy is Square-Enix's most famous and successful franchise and has been going for more than 20 years. There are currently fourteen numbered games, with dozens of spin-offs.

Final Fantasy XI Online: Chains of Promathia
Final Fantasy XI Online: Rise of Zilart

deck: Fabula Nova Crystallis is a sub-franchise of Final Fantasy. The original plan was to create three games that shared a common mythos, but those plans diverged quite drastically over time.
name: Fabula Nova Crystallis

deck: The Burnout franchise incorporates the arcade-style racing made famous by games like Daytona and Ridge Racer and takes it totally over the top by adding ridiculous speeds and gigantic crashes.
name: Burnout

deck: The Elder Scrolls is a long-running franchise of role-playing games made by Bethesda Softworks. The series is known for offering much freedom to the player and many choices of how to play.

games.name: The Elder Scrolls IV: Shivering Isles
The Elder Scrolls IV: Knights of the Nine

name: The Elder Scrolls

deck: The Super Smash Bros. series is Nintendo's premier fighting series, featuring many characters from Nintendo's most popular games as well as third-party characters.

games.name: Super Smash Bros. for Wii U/Nintendo 3DS

name: Super Smash Bros.

deck: Mario, Nintendo's mascot, has been around for over 30 years and still stars in many games, saving Princess Peach from Bowser's numerous plots. Mario is the best selling video game franchise of all time, with an estimated 200 million Mario games sold world-wide.

deck: Open world games that focus on giving the players an innumerable amount of options to viciously murder and wreak havoc across New York City. After the unsatisfactory sales figures of Prototype 2, the franchise was officially canned by Activision.
name: Prototype

deck: This franchise is about World at War game and it's spin-offs.

games.name: Call of Duty: World at War
Call of Duty: World at War Final Fronts

deck: The Darksiders franchise is a series of games, each focusing on one of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse in post-apocalyptic Earth.
name: Darksiders

deck: Civilization on Mars is oppressed and its up to the Red Faction Rebellion to fight back. Red Faction is a unique sci-fi shooter series known for its "GeoMod" technology, which allows for extensive environmental destructibility.
name: Red Faction

deck: A collection of award-winning, first-person shooter, cyberpunk role-playing games.

games.name: Deus Ex: Human Revolution Director's Cut

name: Deus Ex

deck: The God of War franchise is a series of action-adventure games available on Sony PlayStation consoles. It chronicles the exploits of the anti-hero Kratos and his quest for revenge on the Greek Gods for the death of his family.

games.name: God of War: Chains of Olympus
God of War: Ghost of Sparta

name: God of War

deck: A subset of the Call Of Duty franchise, primarily developed by Treyarch.

games.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
Call of Duty: Black Ops Zombies
Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified
Call of Duty: Black Ops III

name: Black Ops

deck: One of the most successful Mario spinoffs. The Mario Kart franchises pits popular Mario characters against each other, racing on courses based on locations throughout the Mario universe. So far, eleven games were released in this franchise.
name: Mario Kart

deck: Soul Calibur is a weapon-based fighting game about two magical swords. Soul Edge is an evil blade of destruction and Soul Calibur is the sword of light. Viewed as the ultimate weapons, the combatants fight to see who will wield the weapons and change the fate of the world.
name: Soul

deck: The spiritual successor to the Devil May Cry series. Bayonetta is a series of action games centering around the titular character, a witch who has to fight evil.
name: Bayonetta

deck: ''Team Fortress'' is a class-based first person shooter which began as a Quake mod and currently exists as Team Fortress 2. TF popularized  class-based multiplayer gaming, in which each player chooses to adopt an explicit role usually defined by unique weapons and abilities.
name: Team Fortress

deck: Far Cry is a franchise of FPS games with a heavy emphasis on free roaming first-person shooting gameplay.
name: Far Cry

deck: Suda 51's bizarre action series starring Travis Touchdown.
name: No More Heroes

deck: Just Cause is a series of free roaming action games with an emphasis on liberation of island nations.
name: Just Cause

deck: The series of games made by Crytek. Includes Crysis, Crysis: Warhead, Crysis 2, and Crysis 3.
name: Crysis

deck: Mercenaries is an open world action game franchise based around a fictional PMC and its operations around the globe. The globe includes North Korea and Venezuela. It was also a spiritual successor to the "Strike" series.
name: Mercenaries

deck: The X-men comic book series has inspired games since 1989, on the NES and since then they have been featured in at least 31 games, spanning several different consoles and handhelds.

games.name: X-Men II: The Fall of the Mutants
X-Men: Legends II - Rise of Apocalypse
Spider-Man and the X-Men: Arcade's Revenge
The Uncanny X-Men: Days of the Future Past

name: X-Men

deck: Marvel Comics is the company responsible for the creation of Spider-Man, The Hulk, Wolverine, and several other comic characters turned video game stars.

deck: Games that focuses on Wolverine's storyline.
name: Wolverine

deck: Dead Rising is an action-adventure, survivor horror video game series, developed by Capcom. It takes much of it's inspirations from the George Romero zombie films, while managing to stay original.

games.name: Dead Rising: Chop Till You Drop

name: Dead Rising

deck: Duke Nukem is a series of shooting games that follow the adventures of their titular character. The series had become the subject of ridicule for the 14-year development cycle of what was to be the sequel to mega-hit Duke Nukem 3D.

games.name: Duke Nukem: Land of the Babes

name: Duke Nukem
